               <div class="ntnu-toggler" id="art-1311616590">
                <h2>
                 Procedure and deadlines per program type
                </h2>
                <div>
                </div>
                <h5 class="toggler-header">
                 <button aria-controls="element-1349354487" aria-expanded="false" data-target="#element-1349354487" data-toggle="collapse" id="head-1349354487" style="font-size:1rem">
                  Exchange or Placement studies
                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head-1349354487" class="collapse" id="element-1349354487">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <h3>
                   Exchange studies
                  </h3>
                  <p>
                   Going on exchange to NTNU from one of our partner institutions to take courses as part of your degree at home.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <a class="ntnu-ibtn primary" href="http://www.ntnu.edu/studies/exchange_students/how_to_apply">
                    See Deadlines and How to Apply
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <h3>
                  </h3>
                  <hr style="font-size: 1rem;"/>
                  <h3>
                   Placement studies
                  </h3>
                  <p>
                   Coming to NTNU for a thesis/ internship/ traineeship/ clinical rotation or similars.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <a class="ntnu-ibtn primary" href="http://www.ntnu.edu/studies/exchange/placementstudents">
                    See Deadlines and How to Apply
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <h3>
                  </h3>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h5 class="toggler-header">
                 <button aria-controls="element-299445188" aria-expanded="false" data-target="#element-299445188" data-toggle="collapse" id="head-299445188" style="font-size:1rem">
                  International Master's programmes
                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head-299445188" class="collapse" id="element-299445188">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <h3>
                   International Master's programmes
                  </h3>
                  <p>
                   Apply for one of NTNU's more than 60 English-language international master's degrees.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <a class="ntnu-ibtn primary" href="http://www.ntnu.edu/studies/imp/how_to_apply">
                    See how to apply
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <h3>
                   Deadlines
                  </h3>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Non-EU/non-EEA: 1 December
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    EU/EEA: 1 March
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Nordic/Norwegian: 15 April
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                  <p>
                   <strong>
                    There may be exemptions to the above deadlines.
                   </strong>
                   Please
                   <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/international/master">
                    see the study programme of your interest
                   </a>
                   for further information.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Note that the deadline is
                   <strong>
                    1 March
                   </strong>
                   <strong>
                    for all applicants with a Norwegian or Nordic Citizenship and an education background from a country outside the Nordics.
                   </strong>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Confused? Use
                   <a href="https://www.ntnu.no/machform/view.php?id=1052773">
                    this guide
                   </a>
                   to determine your application deadline.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h5 class="toggler-header">
                 <button aria-controls="element-1422783703" aria-expanded="false" data-target="#element-1422783703" data-toggle="collapse" id="head-1422783703" style="font-size:1rem">
                  Joint Nordic Master's  |  Erasmus Mundus Master's
                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head-1422783703" class="collapse" id="element-1422783703">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <h3>
                   Joint Nordic Master's degrees
                  </h3>
                  <p>
                   Do a joint degree at two of the five leading technical universities in the Nordic countries,
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <a class="ntnu-ibtn primary" href="http://www.ntnu.edu/studies/nordic-master-programmes">
                    See how to apply
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <strong>
                    Deadline:
                   </strong>
                   15 January
                  </p>
                  <hr/>
                  <h3>
                   Erasmus Mundus Master's programmes
                  </h3>
                  <p>
                   Apply for a prestigious Erasmus+ programme, jointly delivered by an international consortium of universities.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <a class="ntnu-ibtn primary" href="http://www.ntnu.edu/studies/erasmus-mundus-master-s-programmes">
                    See how to apply
                   </a>
                   <br/>
                   <br/>
                   The application deadline for Erasmus Mundus degrees varies between programmes. Check the individual programme for more information.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h5 class="toggler-header">
                 <button aria-controls="element-965618843" aria-expanded="false" data-target="#element-965618843" data-toggle="collapse" id="head-965618843" style="font-size:1rem">
                  Degrees taught in Norwegian
                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head-965618843" class="collapse" id="element-965618843">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <p>
                   Apply for one of NTNU's Norwegian-taught Master's programmes.
                   <br/>
                   Norwegian language requirements apply.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <a class="ntnu-ibtn primary" href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/allstudies?city=&studyLevel=&field=&query=&open=true&taughtInEnglish=false">
                    See all Norwegian programmes
                   </a>
                   <br/>
                   <br/>
                   <strong>
                    Deadline:
                   </strong>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Applicants with a secondary education from a Nordic country:
                   <strong>
                    15 April
                   </strong>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <a href="https://www.ntnu.no/studier/opptak">
                    Exemptions to these deadlines
                   </a>
                   may apply to some study programmes
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h5 class="toggler-header">
                 <button aria-controls="element-100901857" aria-expanded="false" data-target="#element-100901857" data-toggle="collapse" id="head-100901857" style="font-size:1rem">
                  PhD programmes
                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head-100901857" class="collapse" id="element-100901857">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <h4>
                   <a class="ntnu-ibtn primary" href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/allstudies?city=&studyLevel=980&field=&query=&open=true&taughtInEnglish=true">
                    See all PhD programmes
                   </a>
                  </h4>
                  <p>
                   <br/>
                   The deadlines vary depending upon the individual vacancies
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>

              </div>
             </div>

	var pathnameRegexp = /\/documents\/(\d+)\/(\d+)\/(.+?)\/([^&]+)/;

	function handleDownloadClick(event) {
		if (event.target.nodeName.toLowerCase() === 'a') {
			if (window.Analytics) {
				var anchor = event.target;
				var match = pathnameRegexp.exec(anchor.pathname);

				if (match) {
					var getParameterValue = function(parameterName) {
						var result = null;
						var tmp = [];

						anchor
							.search
							.substr(1)
							.split("&")
							.forEach(
								function(item) {
									tmp = item.split("=");
									if (tmp[0] === parameterName) result = decodeURIComponent(tmp[1]);
								}
							);
						return result;
					}

					var groupId = match[1];
					var fileEntryUUID = match[4];

					fetch(
						'https://www.ntnu.edu/o/document_library/analytics/resolve_file_entry?groupId=' + encodeURIComponent(groupId) + '&uuid=' + encodeURIComponent(fileEntryUUID),
						{
							credentials: 'include',
							method: 'GET'
						}
					).then(function(response) {
						return response.json();
					}).then(function(response) {
						Analytics.send(

								title: decodeURIComponent(match[3].replace(/\+/ig, ' ')),
								version: getParameterValue('version')
							}
						);
					}).catch(function() {
						return;
					});
				}
			}
		}
	}

	document.body.addEventListener('click', handleDownloadClick);

Norwegian University of Science and Technology

This is NTNU video

About NTNU – Norwegian University of Science and Technology

43 550
Students
8960
Employees
390
Study programmes
NOK 11 bill
Annual budget

NTNU is an international oriented university with headquarters in Trondheim and campuses in Gjøvik and Ålesund .

NTNU has a main profile in science and technology , a variety of programmes of professional study, and great academic breadth that also includes the humanities, social sciences, economics, medicine, health sciences, educational science, architecture, entrepreneurship, art disciplines and artistic activities.

The university's root goes back to 1760 with the foundation of Det Trondhiemske Selskab (Trondheim Academy). A merger in 2016 made NTNU Norway's largest single university.

Studies, research, innovation

Studies

  • Norway’s biggest university with headquarters in Trondheim
  • 390 study programmes and with 43 555 students, of which 3872 (9 per cent) are international students
  • Three cities – Trondheim, Gjøvik and Ålesund
Study at NTNU

Research

  • Host or parter in several national research centres
  • Participates i 611 EU Framework Programme projects and awarded 42 ERC grants
  • More than 100 laboratories / research infrastructure, of which several are national resources
Research at NTNU

Innovation

  • Host or partner in 6 centres of excellence
  • Host or partner in 12 centres for research-based innovation
  • Host or partner in 19 research centres for environment-friendly energy research
  • 13 innovation managers and innovation scholarship scheme for PhD candidates

        <style data-senna-track="temporary" type="text/css">

/* II-3112 CAS:UTV-IT 31-mars-2022  */

:root {
    --ntnu-ub-light: #d5ecee;
    --ntnu-ub-dark: #28585A;
    --ntnu-ub-darker: #1f4344;
}

.bg-ub-light {
    background-color: var(--ntnu-ub-light)!important;
}

.bg-ub-dark {
    background-color: var(--ntnu-ub-dark)!important;
}

.text-ub-dark {
    color: var(--ntnu-ub-dark)!important;
}

a.text-ub-dark:hover,
a.text-ub-dark:focus {
    background: var(--ntnu-ub-light);
}


/* nav: add accent color  */

#navigationCollapse.sticky {
    background-color: var(--ntnu-ub-light)!important;
}

#navigation .navbar-site li {
    padding: 0 20px;
    border-radius: 50px;
}

#navigation .navbar-site li.nav-item.active {
    background-color: var(--ntnu-ub-light)!important;
}

#navigation .navbar-site li.nav-item:hover {
    background-color: var(--ntnu-ub-light)!important;
}

.ub-hide-buildings * .ub-hidden-sometimes,
.columns-1-2-1-66-33 .ub-hidden-sometimes {
    display: none!important;
}


/* smaller concerns */

@media screen and (max-width: 767px) {
    .display-4 {
        font-size: 2em !important;
    }
    #home_href img {
        display: none !important;
    }
    #banner h1.sr-only {
        display: inline-block;
        position: initial;
        width: auto;
        height: auto;
        color: #000;
        clip: unset!important;
        clip-path: unset;
        font-size: 16px;
    }
}

.icon-square {
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    width: 3rem;
    height: 3rem;
    font-size: 1.5rem;
    border-radius: 5px;
    color: var(--ntnu-ub-dark);
}


/* first page only */

#breadcrumbs {
    background-color: var(--ntnu-ub-dark);
    margin-bottom: -2px;
}

#breadcrumbs a,
#breadcrumbs * {
    color: #ffffff!important;
}

.ntnu-crumbs {
    max-height: 48px!important;
}

			if (window.pageYOffset > sticky) {
				navline.classList.add("sticky");
				document.body.style.paddingTop = navline.offsetHeight + "px";
			}
			else {
				navline.classList.remove("sticky");
				document.body.style.paddingTop = "0px";

(function() {var $ = AUI.$;var _ = AUI._;
	var pathnameRegexp = /\/documents\/(\d+)\/(\d+)\/(.+?)\/([^&]+)/;

	function handleDownloadClick(event) {
		if (event.target.nodeName.toLowerCase() === 'a') {
			if (window.Analytics) {
				var anchor = event.target;
				var match = pathnameRegexp.exec(anchor.pathname);

				if (match) {
					var getParameterValue = function(parameterName) {
						var result = null;
						var tmp = [];

						anchor
							.search
							.substr(1)
							.split("&")
							.forEach(
								function(item) {
									tmp = item.split("=");
									if (tmp[0] === parameterName) result = decodeURIComponent(tmp[1]);
								}
							);
						return result;
					}

					var groupId = match[1];
					var fileEntryUUID = match[4];

					fetch(
						'https://www.ntnu.edu/o/document_library/analytics/resolve_file_entry?groupId=' + encodeURIComponent(groupId) + '&uuid=' + encodeURIComponent(fileEntryUUID),
						{
							credentials: 'include',
							method: 'GET'
						}
					).then(function(response) {
						return response.json();
					}).then(function(response) {
						Analytics.send(
							'documentDownloaded',
							'Document',
							{
								groupId: groupId,
								fileEntryId: response.fileEntryId,
								preview: !!window._com_liferay_document_library_analytics_isViewFileEntry,
								title: decodeURIComponent(match[3].replace(/\+/ig, ' ')),
								version: getParameterValue('version')
							}
						);
					}).catch(function() {
						return;
					});
				}
			}
		}
	}

	document.body.addEventListener('click', handleDownloadClick);

	var onDestroyPortlet = function() {
		document.body.removeEventListener('click', handleDownloadClick);
		Liferay.detach('destroyPortlet', onDestroyPortlet);
	}

	Liferay.on('destroyPortlet', onDestroyPortlet);
})();(function() {var $ = AUI.$;var _ = AUI._;

				}
			);

	var onDestroyPortlet = function() {

                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head107467838" class="collapse" id="element107467838">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <p>
                   Don’t miss out! NTNU Alumni sends you monthly newsletters with invitations to what is happening in the network, research news, and inspiring portraits of our alumni.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h5 class="toggler-header">
                 <button aria-controls="element603871796" aria-expanded="false" data-target="#element603871796" data-toggle="collapse" id="head603871796" style="font-size:1rem">
                  Be invited to conferences, seminars and social events
                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head603871796" class="collapse" id="element603871796">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <p>
                   Every year we have many events both locally and internationally, online and in person – but you must be a member to be invited.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   A perfect place to meet other alumni and students, and to build networks across sectors and industries.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h5 class="toggler-header">
                 <button aria-controls="element155422778" aria-expanded="false" data-target="#element155422778" data-toggle="collapse" id="head155422778" style="font-size:1rem">
                  Get an invitation to the annual alumni lecture
                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head155422778" class="collapse" id="element155422778">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <p>
                   How do NTNU’s former students make a difference? One way you can get an insight into this through the annual alumni lecture, where one of NTNU’s alumni holds a lecture for students, alumni and staff.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The 2023 Alumni Lecture will be held in February. The name and topic will be launched in December 2022.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h5 class="toggler-header">
                 <button aria-controls="element-1347109555" aria-expanded="false" data-target="#element-1347109555" data-toggle="collapse" id="head-1347109555" style="font-size:1rem">
                  Get an online LinkedIn course exclusively for NTNU people
                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head-1347109555" class="collapse" id="element-1347109555">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <p>
                   You get access to an online course over three sessions, developed specifically for NTNU people.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The videos help you create an integrated profile on LinkedIn and strengthen the impact of your posts.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Increase your visibility and network with other alumni through our NTNU Alumni group on LinkedIn.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <em>
                    Access to log in to the courses will be sent to you after you have registered.
                   </em>
                   <br/>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h5 class="toggler-header">
                 <button aria-controls="element216897215" aria-expanded="false" data-target="#element216897215" data-toggle="collapse" id="head216897215" style="font-size:1rem">
                  Get information about continuing and further education from NTNU
                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head216897215" class="collapse" id="element216897215">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <p>
                   Through the NTNU Alumni network, you’ll always get the latest information about the opportunities that the university offers for further education.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   You can take training courses, individual courses or a master’s degree – all part-time and alongside your job.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   NTNU’s Centre for Continuing and Professional Development (NTNU Videre) offers programmes and courses in technology and society, schooling and education, health and care services, economics and management.
                   <br/>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h5 class="toggler-header">
                 <button aria-controls="element-1054977463" aria-expanded="false" data-target="#element-1054977463" data-toggle="collapse" id="head-1054977463" style="font-size:1rem">
                  Join one or more network groups
                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head-1054977463" class="collapse" id="element-1054977463">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <p>
                   You can take part in network groups across disciplines in your sector.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The network groups are an arena for your academic community to benefit from each other’s experiences, expertise and networks.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   NTNU Alumni also gives you the opportunity to get to know other alumni all over the world by getting involved in an international network group.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h5 class="toggler-header">
                 <button aria-controls="element2091784869" aria-expanded="false" data-target="#element2091784869" data-toggle="collapse" id="head2091784869" style="font-size:1rem">
                  Get access to NTNU’s closed library services
                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head2091784869" class="collapse" id="element2091784869">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <p>
                   As a member of NTNU Alumni, you get access to library services, including bachelor’s, master’s and doctoral theses.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
                <h5 class="toggler-header">
                 <button aria-controls="element284109734" aria-expanded="false" data-target="#element284109734" data-toggle="collapse" id="head284109734" style="font-size:1rem">
                  Exclusively for students: Free, customized career courses
                 </button>
                </h5>
                <div aria-labelledby="head284109734" class="collapse" id="element284109734">
                 <div class="card-body" style="padding-left:1.66rem">
                  <p>
                   When you join NTNU Alumni, you get a customized course provided by NTNU’s career services, NTNU Karriere.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The course is held in person on our three campuses and lasts for two hours.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The main topics of the course will be  networking, mapping your competencies, and job search strategies. Tips and advice on writing CVs and job applications as well as job interviews are also included.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   <em>
                    You will get information about how to register as the courses are set up.
                   </em>
                   <br/>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="content-metadata-asset-addon-entries">
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </section>
         </div>

               <div class="normal">
                <h1>
                 NTNU International Researcher Support
                </h1>
                <div class="innholdstekst">
                 <figure class="image">
                  <img alt="Two young researchers in a lab" height="800" src="https://www.ntnu.edu/documents/661355621/641205799/Sustainable+energy_lab.jpg/bb73c434-82b5-6c53-07bc-41b6d13f3e25?t=1742294097565" style="width: 100%; height: 100%; margin: 0px;" title="" width="1200"/>
                  <figcaption>
                   Photo: Geir Mogen/NTNU
                  </figcaption>
                 </figure>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   NTNU International Researcher Support (NIRS)
                  </strong>
                  offers counseling services for administrative staff and academics working at or visiting NTNU. Other services offered by NIRS include housing, dual career services (career support for spouses & partners of international academic staff), seminars, courses, and social activities for the international community at NTNU.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   <a class="ntnu-ibtn primary" href="https://www.ntnu.edu/nirs/contact">
                    NIRS contact information
                   </a>
                  </strong>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  We do not accept open job applications. If you are interested in job opportunities at NTNU please
                 </p>
                 <ul>
                  <li>
                   see our website with
                   <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/vacancies">
                    <strong>
                     vacancies and job openings
                    </strong>
                   </a>
                   or
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   contact
                   <strong>
                    <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/faculties">
                     the department
                    </a>
                   </strong>
                   relevant to your academic background directly.
                  </li>
                 </ul>
                </div>

	var pathnameRegexp = /\/documents\/(\d+)\/(\d+)\/(.+?)\/([^&]+)/;

	function handleDownloadClick(event) {
		if (event.target.nodeName.toLowerCase() === 'a') {
			if (window.Analytics) {
				var anchor = event.target;
				var match = pathnameRegexp.exec(anchor.pathname);

				if (match) {
					var getParameterValue = function(parameterName) {
						var result = null;
						var tmp = [];

						anchor
							.search
							.substr(1)
							.split("&")
							.forEach(
								function(item) {
									tmp = item.split("=");
									if (tmp[0] === parameterName) result = decodeURIComponent(tmp[1]);
								}
							);
						return result;

					var groupId = match[1];

					fetch(

						return;

				}

			else {
				navline.classList.remove("sticky");
				document.body.style.paddingTop = "0px";
			}
		}
		window.addEventListener("scroll", checkSticky);
	}

  1. Cookies

Språkvelger

Norsk

Cookies

Cookies

Cookies

Cookies can be very helpful and provide an enhanced user experience. NTNU uses cookies in their web solutions.

Consent

By using NTNU's websites, you agree that we may leave cookies in your browser. Most modern browsers (Chrome, Internet Explorer, Firefox, Safari, Opera, etc.) are set to accept cookies automatically. If you wish to disable cookies in your browser, you can do this in the browser's security settings. More on this below .

What is a cookie?

A cookie is a text file that is downloaded and stored on your computer when you visit a website. Cookies can be used to store user settings, and to record the pages you visit and which choices you make while using them. You can read more about cookies and how you use them by clicking "Help" in your browser.

What does NTNU use cookies for?

NTNU never uses cookies to survey an individual user's pattern of use or other information, which could violate your user's privacy protections.

NTNU uses cookies for the following purposes:

  • to store user preferences, e.g. language settings
  • to manage logons, and sessions
  • to collect statistics in order to improve NTNU's web pages

NTNU gathers statistics using SiteImprove. This means that information regarding your use of our web pages, including your IP address, can be transferred to Google.

What are cookies on NTNU's external web pages used for?

The information below applies to:

  • www.ntnu.no
  • www.ntnu.edu
  • i.ntnu.no
  • innsida.ntnu.no
  • studntnu.sharepoint.com
  • videre.ntnu.no
  • alumni.ntnu.no

What are cookies on NTNU's external web pages used for

Website

Cookies are used to ...

www.ntnu.no

– identify the user's session on the website
– keep track of the web page's language settings

www.ntnu.edu

– identify the user's session on the website
– keep track of the web page's language settings

i.ntnu.no – identify the user's session on the website
– keep track of the web page's language settings

innsida.ntnu.no

– identify the user's session on the website
– keep track of the web page's language settings
– keep track of the settings made by the user on Innsida, so the user does not have to make the same choices over again

studntnu.sharepoint.com – identify the user's session on the website
– keep track of display settings
– persist authorization from NTNU
nyheter.ntnu.no

- identify the user's session on the website

- keep track of the web pages's language settings

Cookies used on the aforementioned domains.

Cookie

Description

Vendor
nmstat Collect info about site usage, such as last visit, using a randomly generated ID used to recognize the browser and visitor. The cookie contains no personal information.

Siteimprove

siteimproveses Tracks the sequence of pages a visitor looks at during a visit to the site. Siteimprove
skyra.state The user's device is assigned a random code. Using this code, Skyra can remember the user and whether surveys are open, closed, or completed. Skyra
skyra<survey-slug> Purpose: Stores the answers the user provides during a survey, ensuring the correct cards are shown as the user navigates between pages.
Duration: Automatically deleted after a few hours, depending on the survey setup, or when the survey is completed or closed. 		Skyra
wp-wpml_current_language Keep track of the web pages's language settings

How to delete cookies

If you want to delete the cookies or make sure that cookies cannot be installed, you can change your browser settings.

About this website

About this website

The Communication Division is the System Owner of NTNU's External Website and Intranet.

  • The responsible editor is Communications Director Sigrun Berge Engen .
  • The daily web operations are carried out by the Communications Division. The web editor is Tone Kvenild .
  • NTNU IT is responsible for the technical aspects of the web solutions.

Questions and comments about NTNU's web: Students and employees, please use hjelp.ntnu.no . Are you an external visitor, please use kontakt@komm.ntnu.no .

The faculties and other major units at NTNU have their own web editors with local responsibility for the webpages of their respective units.

There are many web-based services at NTNU (e.g., payroll system, case management tools, e-learning tools, library search, student web, etc.) that internally have their own system owners. The Communications Division can assist in connecting you with the relevant contact if you have questions about any of these systems.

Statement of responsibility for NTNU's website

This website contains information published by the Norwegian University of Science and Technology, NTNU.

Please note that the content is a mix of official and unofficial information, and the institution NTNU does not assume legal responsibility for the accuracy of all the information presented on these pages. By official information, we mean information or references made available by employees, students, or others on behalf of NTNU. We aim to ensure that all such information is up-to-date and reliable.

If you discover errors, we kindly ask you to report them using the contact address provided at the bottom of each page. On Innsida, you can find guidelines for web work, contact information, and a link to NTNU Help, where you can submit your inquiries: https://i.ntnu.no/en/www . If you are not an employee or student at NTNU, please send an email: kontakt@komm.ntnu.no .

NTNU is not responsible for any technical issues that may arise from downloading files from NTNU's website or from following links from our pages to other websites.

The Communications Division, NTNU
